job_title: Patient Relations Specialist in Oak Bluffs, MA
cons: being underpaid and stressed most of the time due to the amount of responsibilities you are being assigned every day.

job_title: Senior Patient Access Representative in Dover, NH
pros: Continually expanding services to meet needs of growing population of the island. Great benefits for employees.

review_title: Has the potential to be fabulous but with a lot of dead wood
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oak Bluffs, MA
pros: Nursing is nursing.  What makes the job are the people you work with and in some cases there are some wonderful people here.  Most of middle management is trying really hard to make their departments run smoothly so there is some superficial support.  There is some opportunity to move around and grow in the hospital.  And living on the island is bliss…
cons: The flip side is there are some hostile and crazy employees whom I do not understand why they have jobs.  These not so few people have the ability to disrupt moral to a point that I (and I know others) have left the hospital.  Finally the hospital is only staffed for a best case scenario, and how often does the best case scenario happen in healthcare?

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oak Bluffs, MA
pros: Small institution but offers opportunities for many services, staff is friendly, competent professionals
cons: The culture could use a little improvement towards more professionalism especially in the MD's office.
I didn't feel like the Admin knew what the problems were from the employee's side. They were entirely bottm-line focused.
